revised_title: Late-glacial Deposits and Vegetational History in Caernarvonshire
tldr: The authors studied the late-glacial deposits at Llyn Dwythwch and Nant Ffrancon in Caernarvonshire, analyzing the stratigraphy and pollen content of the sediments. They found that the deposits were formed during the Late-glacial Period, with a sequence of organic material sandwiched between two layers of soliflucted inorganic material. The study provides insights into the climate and vegetation of the region during the Late-glacial Period and the subsequent Post-glacial Period.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Quaternary geology
